meanings.definition: To return to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, the weather started reverting to its usual calmness.
meanings.sent2: She was reverting to her old habits of staying up late.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reverting to knocking over the same vase every time I turned my back.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky was reverting to a beautiful palette of colors.
meanings.sent5: The garden, once neglected, was reverting to a lush paradise with each passing day.

meanings.definition: To go back to a previous topic or subject.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the discussion kept reverting to the budget concerns.
meanings.sent2: Whenever they argued, the conversation would always revert to past mistakes.
meanings.sent3: In class, the teacher's attempts to discuss science kept reverting to stories about his cat.
meanings.sent4: The book club's conversation was reverting to a heated debate about the ending of the novel.
meanings.sent5: No matter how hard they tried, the group discussion kept reverting to the same old arguments.

meanings.definition: To reply or respond in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: When asked about his plans, he would always revert to talking about his favorite hobby.
meanings.sent2: She tended to revert to silence whenever the topic turned to her past.
meanings.sent3: During the interview, the politician kept reverting to rehearsed answers regardless of the questions.
meanings.sent4: The child would often revert to giggling whenever someone told a joke.
meanings.sent5: In times of stress, she would revert to humming her favorite tune to calm herself down.
